Package it.polimi.ingsw.Controller

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Controller.MainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
Manage the news received.

  • Method Details

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange​(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent propertyChangeEvent)
      Handles news objects received by remote views. Equivalent of Observable's update().
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
      See Also:
      PropertyChangeListener

    • endGame

      private void endGame​(NoMoreMovesException e)
      Called when the game has to be closed. Takes care of clearing gametable and setting the winner/losers.
      Parameters:
      e - exception containing the player who has no more moves

    • getNews

      public News getNews()

    • isLegalTurnState

      public static void isLegalTurnState​(java.lang.String name, ClientState turn) throws IllegalTurnStateException
      Checks whether the player is in a legal state for the move it wants to make.
      Parameters:
      name - Turn state from Client side
      turn - Turn state from Server side
      Throws:
      IllegalTurnStateException - if not matching

    • setGameInitializer

      public void setGameInitializer​(GameInitializer gameInitializer)

    • consoleKickPlayer

      public void consoleKickPlayer​(java.lang.String playerNick)
      If present, kicks the player from the game and checks whether other players possibly won as a result of that
      Parameters:
      playerNick - player to be kicked from game

    • saveGameState

      public void saveGameState()
      Persistence method to save the current game's state to disk.

    • containsPlayer

      public int containsPlayer​(java.lang.String playerNick)
      Checks whether a player is present in the game, by nickname
      Parameters:
      playerNick - Nickname of players to be checked
      Returns:
      index of player if present, else -1

    • setPlayerFromDisk

      public void setPlayerFromDisk​(java.lang.String name, SocketClientConnection c)
      Persistence method to recreate player from disk.
      Parameters:
      name - name of players to be set
      c - connection to be associated with the player

    • getPlayersNumber

      public int getPlayersNumber()
      Returns:
      number of players in game

    • restartFromDisk

      public void restartFromDisk​(java.util.ArrayList<SocketClientConnection> connections)
      Persistence main method: restarts game from disk. Basically the equivalent of GameInitializer for a reloaded game.
      Parameters:
      connections - Contains every player's connection, in order from first to last.
